module.name: Grids
module.short: Classes for displaying tabular data as a series of rows and columns.

descr.p: grids.pas contains classes, types, constants, variables, and routines used to implement grid controls for the Lazarus Component Library (LCL). Classes include:
Original author: Jesus Reyes Aguilar (jesusrmx@yahoo.com.mx) [2002]

element.name: GRIDFILEVERSION
element.short: Current revision level for the grids.pas file.

dl.dd: Initial revision
Introduced goSmoothScroll grid option
Introduced Col/Row FixedAttr and NormalAttr

element.name: GM_SETVALUE
element.short: Lazarus message for setting the value in a grid edit control.

element.name: GM_GETVALUE
element.short: Lazarus message for getting the value in a grid edit control.

element.name: GM_SETGRID
element.short: Lazarus message for setting the grid for an edit control.

element.name: GM_SETBOUNDS
element.short: Lazarus message for setting the bounds for a grid edit control.

element.name: GM_SELECTALL
element.short: Lazarus message for selecting the content in a grid edit control.

element.name: GM_SETMASK
element.short: Lazarus message for setting the edit mask used in a grid edit control.

element.name: GM_SETPOS
element.short: Lazarus message for setting the position of a grid edit control.

element.name: GM_READY
element.short: Lazarus message sent when the grid can display its editing controls.

element.name: GM_GETGRID
element.short: Lazarus message used to get the grid for an editing control.

element.name: EO_AUTOSIZE
element.short: Represents the auto-size editor option in a grid message.

element.name: EO_HOOKKEYDOWN
element.short: Represents the hook key down editor option in a grid message.

element.name: EO_HOOKKEYPRESS
element.short: Represents the hook key press editor option in a grid message.

element.name: EO_HOOKKEYUP
element.short: Represents the hook key up editor option in a grid message.

element.name: EO_SELECTALL
element.short: Represents the select all content editor option in a grid message.

element.name: EO_IMPLEMENTED
element.short: Represents the implemented editor option in a grid message.

element.name: DEFCOLWIDTH
element.short: Default width for columns in a grid control.

descr.p: DEFCOLWIDTH is a constant used as the default width for columns in a grid control. The value for the constant is 64 (pixels). DEFCOLWIDTH is used when getting the value for the DefColWidth in TCustomGrid.

element.name: DEFBUTTONWIDTH
element.short: Default width for edit control buttons in a grid.

descr.p: DEFBUTTONWIDTH is a constant that contains the default width for the button displayed in a grid cell editor. The value for the constant is 25 (pixels). DEFBUTTONWIDTH is used when setting the bounds for TButtonCellEditor controls.

element.name: DEFIMAGEPADDING
element.short: Default padding used for title images displayed in a grid.

descr.p: DEFIMAGEPADDING is a constant which contains the padding added to images displayed in the fixed title area for grid controls. The value for the constant is 2 (pixels). DEFIMAGEPADDING is used in methods like TCustomGrid.DrawColumnTitleImage and TCustomStringGrid.AutoAdjustColumn.

element.name: EGridException
element.short: Exception raised for an error occurring in a Grid class.

descr.p: Used mainly when a row or a column position is invalid for a grid control.

element.name: TGridOption
element.short: Represents grip option values available for grid controls.

descr.p: TGridOption is an enumerated type with values that represent grid options available in LCL grid controls. Values from TGridOption are stored in a TGridOptions set type to indicate that the grid feature or behavior is enabled.
Values from TGridOption are stored in the DefaultGridOptions constant which defines the default set of options for LCL grid controls.

element.name: TGridOption.goFixedVertLine
element.short: Shows vertical lines around fixed cells.

element.name: TGridOption.goFixedHorzLine
element.short: Shows horizontal lines around fixed cells.

element.name: TGridOption.goVertLine
element.short: Show vertical lines.

element.name: TGridOption.goHorzLine
element.short: Show horizontal lines.

element.name: TGridOption.goRangeSelect
element.short: Enables range selection for grid cells.

element.name: TGridOption.goDrawFocusSelected
element.short: Enables focused drawing for selected cell(s).

element.name: TGridOption.goRowSizing
element.short: Allow user to change row height.

element.name: TGridOption.goColSizing
element.short: Allow user to change column width.

element.name: TGridOption.goRowMoving
element.short: Enables moving the position of an entire row in a grid.

element.name: TGridOption.goColMoving
element.short: Enables moving the position of an entire column in a grid.

element.name: TGridOption.goEditing
element.short: Allows editing in grid cells.

element.name: TGridOption.goAutoAddRows
element.short: Automatically add new rows.
element.descr: Does not add rows if the last cell is empty and goAutoAddRowsSkipContentCheck is not set.

element.name: TGridOption.goTabs
element.short: Controls Tab key behavior in the grid.

descr.p: When included in the TCustomGrid.Options property, the Tab key changes the active cell within the grid. When omitted from the grid Options, the Tab key changes to the next active control.

element.name: TGridOption.goRowSelect
element.short: Select the whole row instead of only one cell.

element.name: TGridOption.goAlwaysShowEditor
element.short: Always shows the cell editor.

descr.p: Always shows the cell editor. If not set, the user has to enter edit mode by data characters for the cell, or by pressing the F2 key.

element.name: TGridOption.goThumbTracking
element.short: Enables tracking of the thumb position in grid scroll bars.

element.name: TGridOption.goColSpanning
element.short: Enable cellextent calculations.

element.name: TGridOption.goRelaxedRowSelect
element.short: User can see focused cell on goRowSelect.

element.name: TGridOption.goDblClickAutoSize
element.short: Double clicking column's borders (on headers) resize column.

element.name: TGridOption.goSmoothScroll
element.short: Switch scrolling mode.
element.descr: Default is pixel scroll.

element.name: TGridOption.goFixedRowNumbering
element.short: Show row numbers in first fixed column.

descr.p: The displayed row numbers starts with 1. The row number is displayed when no text has been directly assigned to the fixed cell.

element.name: TGridOption.goScrollKeepVisible
element.short: Keeps focused cell visible while scrolling.

element.name: TGridOption.goHeaderHotTracking
element.short: Header cells change look when mouse is over them.

element.name: TGridOption.goHeaderPushedLook
element.short: Header cells looks pushed when clicked.

element.name: TGridOption.goSelectionActive
element.short: Setting grid selection also moves the cell cursor.

element.name: TGridOption.goFixedColSizing
element.short: Allow to resize fixed columns.

element.name: TGridOption.goDontScrollPartCell
element.short: Selecting a partially visible cell will not scroll the grid content.

element.name: TGridOption.goCellHints
element.short: Show individual cell hints.
element.descr: Requires the ShowHint to be set to TRUE. If set, the Hint will be ignored. Instead the OnGetCellHint event will be called for each cell.

element.name: TGridOption.goTruncCellHints
element.short: Truncates cell hints when they are longer than the cell content.

element.name: TGridOption.goCellEllipsis
element.short: Shows an Ellipsis (...) at the end of truncated cell hints.

element.name: TGridOption.goAutoAddRowsSkipContentCheck
element.short: Also add a row if last row is empty.
element.descr: goAutoAddRows must also be set. Otherwise this option does not take effect at all.

element.name: TGridOption.goRowHighlight
element.short: Highlights the current Row in a grid control.

element.name: TGridOptions
element.short: Set type used to store enabled grid options.

descr.p: TGridOptions is a set type used to store values from the TGridOption enumeration. The features or behaviors in TGridOption are enabled when their enumeration values are included in the set. TGridOptions is the type used for the TCustomGrid.Options property.

element.name: TGridOption2
element.short: Represents grid options introduced in Version 2 of grid controls.

element.name: TGridOption2.goScrollToLastCol
element.short: Allows scrolling to last column (so that last column can be leftcol).

element.name: TGridOption2.goScrollToLastRow
element.short: Allows scrolling to last row (so that last row can be toprow).

element.name: TGridOptions2
element.short: Set type used to store enabled grid options from TGridOption2.

element.name: TGridSaveOptions
element.short: Represents save options available for LCL grid controls.

element.name: TGridSaveOptions.soDesign
element.short: Enables saving grid structure (col/row count and Options).

element.name: TGridSaveOptions.soAttributes
element.short: Enables saving grid attributes (Font, Brush, TextStyle).

element.name: TGridSaveOptions.soContent
element.short: Enables saving Grid content (Text in TStringGrid).

element.name: TGridSaveOptions.soPosition
element.short: Enables saving the Grid cursor and selection position.

element.name: TSaveOptions
element.short: Set type used to store TGridSaveOptions values.

element.name: TGridDrawState
element.short: Enumeration with Grid draw state values.

descr.p: TGridDrawState is an enumeration with values that represent grid drawing states for a grid control. Values in TGridDrawState indicate the display attributes applied to a row, column, or individual cell in a grid control.
TGridDrawState arguments are passed to event handlers and methods in TCustomGrid.

element.name: TGridDrawState.gdSelected
element.short: Drawn in its Selected state.

element.name: TGridDrawState.gdFocused
element.short: Drawn in its Focused state.

element.name: TGridDrawState.gdFixed
element.short: Drawn using the Fixed cell colors.

element.name: TGridDrawState.gdHot
element.short: Drawn using the Hot display attributes.

element.name: TGridDrawState.gdPushed
element.short: Drawn in a Pushed state.

element.name: TGridDrawState.gdRowHighlight
element.short: Drawn using the row highlighting color.

element.name: TGridState
element.short: Enumerated type with grid state values.

descr.p: TGridState is an enumerated type with values that reflect the state in a grid control. TGridState values represent actions performed using a grid control, rather the display state for rows, columns, and/or cells.

TCustomGrid maintains an internal TGridState member used to track the state for the grid control. Methods in TCustomGrid cause the value in the member to be read or updated to reflect the request and/or completion of an action in the grid control.
Use the TCustomGrid.Options and TCustomGrid.Options2 properties to determine if specific features or behaviors are enabled for a grid control.

element.name: TGridState.gsNormal
element.short: Normal state for the grid when navigation or editing can be performed.

element.name: TGridState.gsSelecting
element.short: Grid is selecting a row, column, or cell after keyboard or mouse activity.

element.name: TGridState.gsRowSizing
element.short: Grid is resizing a row.

element.name: TGridState.gsColSizing
element.short: Grid is resizing a column.

element.name: TGridState.gsRowMoving
element.short: Grid is moving or dragging a row.

element.name: TGridState.gsColMoving
element.short: Grid is moving or dragging a column.

element.name: TGridState.gsHeaderClicking
element.short: A fixed header cell has been clicked in the Grid.

element.name: TGridState.gsButtonColumnClicking
element.short: A button in a column has been clicked.

element.name: TGridZone
element.short: Enumerated type for grid zone values.

descr.p: TGridZone is an enumeration type with values representing zones in a grid control which are monitored to determine activity and subsequent changes in the grid control state.

element.name: TGridZone.gzNormal
element.short: Area normally used for cell data (not fixed row or column headers).

element.name: TGridZone.gzFixedCols
element.short: Area used for fixed column headers

element.name: TGridZone.gzFixedRows
element.short: Area used for fixed row headers

element.name: TGridZone.gzFixedCells
element.short: Area for fixed cells (both column and row are fixed).

element.name: TGridZone.gzInvalid
element.short: Area not valid for grid cells.

element.name: TGridZoneSet
element.short: Set type used to store TGridZone enumeration values.

element.name: TAutoAdvance
element.short: Enumerated type with values controlling grid auto advance behavior.

descr.p: TAutoAdvance is an enumerated type with values that represent the auto advance behaviors available in a grid control. TAutoAdvance is the type used to represent the AutoAdvance and TabAdvance properties in TCustomGrid.

element.name: TAutoAdvance.aaNone
element.short: Auto advance is not enabled.

element.name: TAutoAdvance.aaDown
element.short: Advances down to the next row in the grid.

element.name: TAutoAdvance.aaRight
element.short: Advances to the right (next cell) in the grid.

element.name: TAutoAdvance.aaLeft
element.short: Advances to the left (previous cell) in the grid.

element.name: TAutoAdvance.aaRightDown
element.short: Advances to the right and then to the next row.

element.name: TAutoAdvance.aaLeftDown
element.short: Advances to the left and then to the next row.

element.name: TAutoAdvance.aaRightUp
element.short: Advances to the right and then to the previous row.

element.name: TAutoAdvance.aaLeftUp
element.short: Advances to the left and then to the previous row.

element.name: TRangeSelectMode
element.short: Range selection modes available in a grid control.

element.name: TRangeSelectMode.rsmSingle
element.short: Allows range selection for a single range in a grid.

element.name: TRangeSelectMode.rsmMulti
element.short: Allows range selection for multiple ranges in a grid.

element.name: TItemType
element.descr: Not used in the current implementation.

element.name: TColumnButtonStyle
element.short: Enumeration with cell editor types available in a grid control.

descr.p: TColumnButtonStyle is an enumerated type with values that represent the different cell editor types available in a grid control. TColumnButtonStyle is the type used for the TGridColumn.ButtonStyle property, and passed as an argument when an editor is requested for a column definition. It is also used when the TCustomGrid.GetDefaultEditor method is called to get the default cell editor for a given column.

element.name: TColumnButtonStyle.cbsAuto
element.short: Button style is automatically determined by the grid control. Results in a TStringCellEditor being used for the cell.

element.name: TColumnButtonStyle.cbsEllipsis
element.short: Button style with an Ellipsis (...) is displayed as the cell editor. Results in a TCompositeCellEditor being used for the cell.

element.name: TColumnButtonStyle.cbsNone
element.short: Indicates no editor is required for a cell.

element.name: TColumnButtonStyle.cbsPickList
element.short: Indicates a Pick List is used in the grid column. Results in a TPickListCellEditor being used for the cell.

element.name: TColumnButtonStyle.cbsCheckboxColumn
element.short: Indicates a CheckBox is displayed as the editor for the grid column.

element.name: TColumnButtonStyle.cbsButton
element.short: Indicates a cell editor with a Button is used in the grid column. Causes a TButtonCellEditor to be created.

element.name: TColumnButtonStyle.cbsButtonColumn
element.short: Indicates a button centered in the cell is used in the grid column.

element.name: TTitleStyle
element.short: Enumeration with values that control the display style for fixed title cells.

descr.p: TTitleStyle is an enumerated type with values that determine the drawing style used for fixed title cells in a grid. TTitleStyle is the type used to implement the TCustomGrid.TitleStyle property, and used in the implementation of the TCustomGrid.DrawCellGrid method.

element.name: TTitleStyle.tsLazarus
element.short: Titles are displayed using the Lazarus drawing style.

element.name: TTitleStyle.tsStandard
element.short: Titles are displayed using the standard drawing style (higher contrast).

element.name: TTitleStyle.tsNative
element.short: Titles are displayed using the drawing style Native to the OS or platform.

element.name: TGridFlagsOption
element.short: Represents state flags used in a grid control.

descr.p: TGridFlagsOption is an enumerated type with values which reflect temporal state changes in a grid control. Values from TGridFlagsOption are stored at run-time in the TGridFlags set type used for the TCustomGrid.GridFlags property.

element.name: TGridFlagsOption.gfEditorUpdateLock
element.short: Indicates a cell is locked during a cell editor update.

element.name: TGridFlagsOption.gfNeedsSelectActive
element.short: Indicates a selection needs to be active prior to mouse down or move actions.

element.name: TGridFlagsOption.gfEditorTab
element.short: Indicates a Tab key can be applied to focus the next cell in the grid.

element.name: TGridFlagsOption.gfRevEditorTab
element.short: Indicates if Shift+Tab can be used to select the previous cell in the grid.

element.name: TGridFlagsOption.gfVisualChange
element.short: Indicates visible changes to row or column sizes can be applied to the grid.

element.name: TGridFlagsOption.gfColumnsLocked
element.short: Indicates columns in the grid are locked and cannot be reordered.

element.name: TGridFlagsOption.gfEditingDone
element.short: Indicates editing using a cell editor has been completed.

element.name: TGridFlagsOption.gfSizingStarted
element.short: Indicates a row or column sizing action is in effect.

element.name: TGridFlagsOption.gfPainting
element.short: Indicates the grid is being redrawn.

element.name: TGridFlagsOption.gfUpdatingSize
element.short: Indicates the grid is updating its size.

element.name: TGridFlagsOption.gfClientRectChange
element.short: Indicates the client rectangle for the grid has changed.

element.name: TGridFlagsOption.gfAutoEditPending
element.short: Indicates a cell editor is being prepared for a newly selected cell in the grid.

element.name: TGridFlagsOption.gfUpdatingScrollbar
element.short: Indicates the visibility of scrollbar(s) has been changed for a grid.

element.name: TGridFlags
element.short: Set type used to store TGridFlagsOption enumeration values.

descr.p: TGridFlags is a set type used to store TGridFlagsOption enumeration values. TGridFlags is the type used to implement the TCustomGrid.GridFlags property.

element.name: TSortOrder
element.short: Enumerated type with sort orders supported in a grid control.

descr.p: TSortOrder is an enumerated type with values for the sort orders supported in a grid control. TSortOrder is the type used to implement the TCustomGrid.SortOrder property.

element.name: TSortOrder.soAscending
element.short: Rows are sorted such that the column is in ascending order.

element.name: TSortOrder.soDescending
element.short: Rows are sorted such that the column is in descending order.

element.name: TPrefixOption
element.short: Indicates if accelerator keys in column titles are handled for a grid.

element.name: TPrefixOption.poNone
element.short: Accelerator keys are ignored in the grid column.

element.name: TPrefixOption.poHeaderClick
element.short: Accelerator keys emulate a mouse click on the column title.

element.name: TMouseWheelOption
element.short: Enumerated type with values that control mouse wheel operation in a grid.

element.name: TMouseWheelOption.mwCursor
element.short: Causes the mouse wheel to move the cursor on the screen.

element.name: TMouseWheelOption.mwGrid
element.short: Causes the mouse wheel to scroll the content in the grid.

element.name: TCellHintPriority
element.short: Represents the cell hint display priorities.

descr.p: A grid control can display three types of hint: the default hint (in the Hint property), individual cell hints (using the OnCellHint event), and hints for truncated cells. TCellHintPriority determines how the hint text is determined when multiple hint text values are available for display.

element.name: TCellHintPriority.chpAll
element.short: Uses all hints (control and cell hints) including short and long display text values.

element.name: TCellHintPriority.chpAllNoDefault
element.short: Uses all hints except the default hint for the grid control.

element.name: TCellHintPriority.chpTruncOnly
element.short: Uses the truncated cell hint text.

element.name: TCellProcessType
element.short: Identifies the action performed for cell content.

descr.p: TCellProcessType is an enumerated type with values that identify the action performed for the content in a grid cell. Values in the enumeration indicate whether cell content is copied or pasted in event handlers. TCellProcessType arguments are passed to the TCustomStringGrid.OnCellProcess event handler.

element.name: TCellProcessType.cpCopy
element.short: Copies the content in a grid cell.

element.name: TCellProcessType.cpPaste
element.short: Pastes content into the grid cell.

element.name: soAll
element.short: All save options available for grid controls.

descr.p: soAll is a TSaveOptions constant with the set representing all of the TGridSaveOptions values available for a LCL grid control.

element.name: DefaultGridOptions
element.short: Set with the default grid options enabled for instances of the grid control.

descr.p: DefaultGridOptions is used as the default value for the Options property in TCustomGrid.

element.name: DefaultGridOptions2
element.short: Default grid options enabled for version 2 of the grid control.

descr.p: DefaultGridOptions2 is used as the default value for the Options2 property in TCustomGrid.

element.name: constRubberSpace
element.short: Default spacing around rubber band rectangles.

element.name: constCellPadding
element.short: Default padding for the content in grid cells.

descr.p: Cell padding is the amount of space added around cell values and hints drawn for a grid control. The value represents the number of pixels added to the boundaries at the default display density (96 PPI). The value may be scaled and stored in the varCellPadding variable when a new instance of a grid control is created. varCellPadding contains the padding value actually applied to the values and hints in the control.

element.name: constColRowBorderTolerance
element.short: Minimum proximity to row or column borders for resizing operations.

element.name: varRubberSpace
element.short: Default padding for the rubber banding rectangle in grid cells.

element.name: varCellpadding
element.short: Default padding for the content in grid cells.

descr.p: Cell padding is the amount of space added around cell values and hints drawn for a grid control. The value represents the number of pixels added to the boundaries at the default display density (96 PPI). The value may be scaled and stored in the varCellPadding variable when a new instance of a grid control is created. varCellPadding contains the padding value actually applied to the values and hints in the control.

element.name: varColRowBorderTolerance
element.short: Proximity threshold for a mouse click near a column boundary.

descr.p: Used during grid column resizing when fixed column sizing has been enabled.

element.name: PCellProps
element.short: Pointer to a TCellProps type.

element.name: TCellProps
element.short: Contains attributes, data, and text for grid cells.

element.name: TCellProps.Attr
element.short: Attributes for a grid cell.

element.name: TCellProps.Data
element.short: Data for a grid cell.

element.name: TCellProps.Text
element.short: Display text for a grid cell.

element.name: PColRowProps
element.short: Pointer to a TColRowProps type.

element.name: TColRowProps
element.short: Contains the size and display attributes for a column or row in a grid.

element.name: TColRowProps.Size
element.short: Not used in the current implementation.

element.name: TColRowProps.FixedAttr
element.short: Not used in the current implementation.

element.name: TColRowProps.NormalAttr
element.short: Not used in the current implementation.

element.name: PGridMessage
element.short: Pointer to a TGridMessage type.

element.name: TGridMessage
element.short: Contains a LCL message and its auxiliary values.

descr.p: TGridMessage is a record type with members representing an LCL message passed to cell editors in a string grid. It is passed as an argument to TStringCellEditor methods (msg_SetMask, msg_GetGrid, et. al.) which handle and apply a specific LCL message.

element.name: TGridMessage.LclMsg
element.short: The LCL message value.

element.name: TGridMessage.Grid
element.short: Grid for the LCL message.

element.name: TGridMessage.Col
element.short: Grid column for the LCL message.

element.name: TGridMessage.Row
element.short: Grid row for the LCL message.

element.name: TGridMessage.Value
element.short: Cell value for the LCL message.

element.name: TGridMessage.CellRect
element.short: Rectangle coordinates for the LCL message.

element.name: TGridMessage.Options
element.short: Options for the LCL message.

element.name: TStringCellEditor
element.short: Implements the default editor for cells in TCustomGrid.

descr.p: TStringCellEditor is a TCustomMaskEdit descendant that implements the default editor for cells in TCustomGrid. TStringCellEditor contains internal members used to reference its Grid control, and to access the row and column numbers for the underlying grid cell. TStringCellEditor also implements methods needed for LCL message passing using TGridMessage. An event handler is also published to perform actions needed when editing has been completed in the cell editor.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.WndProc
element.short: Window handling procedure for the cell editor.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.WndProc.TheMessage
element.short: LCL message for the window handling procedure.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.msg_SetMask
element.short: Issues a message for specifying mask.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.msg_SetMask.Msg
element.short: Message for the control.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.msg_SetValue
element.short: Issues a message for specifying value.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.msg_SetValue.Msg
element.short: Message for the control.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.msg_GetValue
element.short: Issues a message for obtaining value.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.msg_GetValue.Msg
element.short: Message for the control.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.msg_SetGrid
element.short: Issues a message for specifying the grid for the editor.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.msg_SetGrid.Msg
element.short: Message for the control.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.msg_SelectAll
element.short: Issues a message for Selecting all content in the editor.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.msg_SelectAll.Msg
element.short: Message for the control.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.msg_SetPos
element.short: Issues a message for specifying the position for the editor.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.msg_SetPos.Msg
element.short: Message for the control.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.msg_GetGrid
element.short: Message used to get the grid control for the cell editor.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.msg_GetGrid.Msg
element.short: Message for the control.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance. Create calls the inherited constructor using the value in AOwner as an argument. Create sets the value in the AutoSize property to False.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.EditingDone
element.short: Performs actions needed when the cell editor has finished editing the value in a cell.

descr.p: EditingDone is an overridden procedure used to perform actions required when the cell editor has finished editing the value in a cell. EditingDone calls the inherited method, and calls the EditingDone method in the attached Grid control (when assigned) for the cell editor.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.EditText
element.descr: EditText is a published property in TStringCellEditor.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.OnEditingDone
element.descr: OnEditingDone is a published property in TStringCellEditor.

element.name: TButtonCellEditor
element.short: The editor used for button cells in a grid.

descr.p: TButtonCellEditor is a TButton descendant which implements a grid cell editor which uses a button to activate the editor control. TButtonCellEditor maintains interval member variables for the TCustomGrid hosting the editor control. The row and column numbers for the underlying cell in editor control are available in the Row and Col properties. TButtonCellEditor includes methods used to perform LCL message passing using a TGridMessage message type.

element.name: TButtonCellEditor.msg_SetGrid
element.short: Issues a message to specify the grid for the editor.

element.name: TButtonCellEditor.msg_SetBounds
element.short: Issues a message to specifying the bounds for the editor.

element.name: TButtonCellEditor.msg_SetPos
element.short: Issues a message to specify the position for the editor.

element.name: TButtonCellEditor.msg_SetPos.Msg
element.short: LCL message for the grid control.

element.name: TButtonCellEditor.msg_Ready
element.short: Issues a message when the editor is ready.

element.name: TButtonCellEditor.msg_Ready.Msg
element.short: LCL message for the grid control.

element.name: TButtonCellEditor.msg_GetGrid
element.short: Issues a message to get the grid control for the button cell editor.

element.name: TButtonCellEditor.msg_GetGrid.Msg
element.short: LCL message for the grid control.

element.name: TButtonCellEditor.Col
element.short: Column number for the grid cell editor.

descr.p: Col is a public read-only Integer which contains the column number for the cell hosting the editor control.
Use Row to access the row number for the cell hosting the editor control.

element.name: TButtonCellEditor.Row

ACol and ARow are the column and row numbers for the first value in the comparison. BCol and BRow are the column and row number for the second value in the comparison.

Result is a variable Integer argument used to return the relative sort order for the compared values. The event handler must perform the actions needed to compare the cell values, and set the value in Result accordingly. Result should contain the following values:

dl.dd: The cell value at ACol, ARow occurs before the value at BCol, BRow
The compared cells contain the same values
The cell value at ACol, ARow occurs after the cell value at BCol, BRow

element.name: TCustomGrid
element.short: Implements the base class for grid controls.

descr.p: A grid is a collection of cells that are organized in columns and rows. Grids are suitable for showing data that using a tabular layout. For example: tables in a database, or formulae and data in a spreadsheet.
The ColCount and RowCount properties contain the column and row count of the grid.
The FixedCols and FixedRows properties specify the count of fixed columns or rows that are used for headings.
The column widths and row heights of the grid are accessible with the ColWidths and RowHeights properties.
The DefaultColWidth and DefaultRowHeight properties are used to specify default column widths or row heights respectively.

The colors of the cells and the grid elements are specified with the AlternateColor, BorderColor, FixedColor, FixedHotColor, FocusColor, GridLineColor and SelectedColor properties. The GridWidth and GridHeight properties contain the dimension of the entire grid.
The ScrollBars controls the creation of scrollbars for the grid.
The LeftCol, TopRow, VisibleColCount and VisibleRowCount properties contain information about the visible area of the grid.
The Options controls options for the grid.
If the user highlights a cell of the grid, the SelectCell method is called that triggers the OnSelectCell event. The position of the highlighted cell is stored within the Col and Row property.
The MouseToCell method calculates a grid cell from a given screen position.
Huge changes to the grid should be encapsulated in calls to BeginUpdate and EndUpdate to speed up the application.
Component developers must override the DrawCell method in customized grids.

element.name: TCustomGrid.AdjustCount

descr.p: AdjustCount is a procedure used to adjust the row or column count for the grid, and to update properties and cache information for the grid.
IsColumn indicates if the OldValue and NewValue arguments refer to the column or row count for the grid; when IsColumn is True, the values refer to the column count.
OldValue contains the previous row or column count in the grid.
NewValue contains the row or column count on exit from the method.

AdjustCount is called when the value in the RowCount or ColCount is changed. It calls the UpdateCachedSizes and SizeChanged methods. It may also call FixPos when NewValue causes the row or column to be out of range for the grid control.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorGetValue
element.short: Gets the value for a cell editor.

descr.p: EditorGetValue is a Boolean function used to get the value for a cell editor in the grid. EditorGetValue is used in the implementation of TCustomGrid methods like: EditorShowInCell, ResetEditor, MoveExtend, and DestroyHandle. It is used to get the cell value prior to editing, and to display the value from the cell editor when it is hidden.

Validate is a Boolean argument that indicates if the ValidateEntry method is called to validate the edited cell value. When it contains True, ValidateEntry is called prior to calling EditorDoSetValue and/or EditorHide.

The return value contains True when the edited cell value is valid. It also contains True if a cell editor has not been assigned or is not visible, or the method was called at design-time or during component destruction.

element.short: True when the cell is valid or has not been altered.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorGetValue.Validate

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorPos
element.short: Sets the position and size for an active cell editor in the grid.

descr.p: EditorPos is a procedure used to set the position and size for an active cell editor in the grid. EditorPos posts messages to the Editor for the grid, and requires a valid handle for both the grid control and the editor control. No actions are performed in the method when a Handle has not been allocated for the grid or when Editor is unassigned (contains Nil).
A TGridMessage instance with the values in Grid, Col, and Row is dispatched to the Editor to set the Editor position. The bounds for the editor rectangle is calculated and adjusted when needed.
The Font for the grid control is assigned to the Canvas where the editor control is drawn.
A TGridMessage instance with the values in Grid, Col, Row, and the calculated bounds is dispatched to the Editor to set the Editor bounds.

EditorPos is called when visual properties are modified in the control and the editor control is visible. For example: SetRowHeight, SetDefRowHeight, AdjustEditorBounds, SetEditorBorderStyle, SetEditorValue, EditorWidthChanged, GridMouseWheel, WMHScroll, and WMVScroll.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorShowChar
element.short: Applies a UTF-8-encoded character value to the active cell editor.

descr.p: Calls SelectEditor to ensure that the cell Editor is active and enabled for the cell at Col and Row. The Editor is displayed (when available) if the value in Ch is handled in the editor control, and is not marked as read-only. The character in Ch is posted to the widgetset class for the grid.

This method bypasses the KeyDown handler for the class instance, and as a result does not automatically reset RowAutoInsert when Ch contains the Backspace key (Ctrl+H). RowAutoInsert is manually set to False in the method when the Backspace character is detected.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorShowChar.Ch

No actions are performed in the method at design-time.

element.name: TCustomGrid.CalcFocusRect
element.short: Calculates the bounds for a focus rectangle in the grid control.

descr.p: When row selection is enabled in the grid Options, the Left and Right values in ARect are updated to use cached grid information in GCache. Calls FlipRect to account for Right-to-Left alignment when needed.

Adjust indicates whether values in ARect are adjusted for horizontal or vertical grid lines drawn in the control. No additional actions are performed when Adjust is set to False. The default value for the parameter is True.
When goHorzLine is included in Options, the Bottom value in ARect is decremented to accommodate the horizontal grid line.

When goVertLine is included in Options, the Left or Right value in ARect is adjusted to accommodate the vertical grid line. Left is incremented when UseRightToLeftAlignment is set to True. Right is decremented when UseRightToLeftAlignment is set to False.
CalcFocusRect is called from the DrawRow and DrawFocusRect methods.

element.name: TCustomGrid.CheckLimits
element.short: Checks column and row limits for the specified cell.

descr.p: CheckLimits is a procedure used to constrain the specified cell coordinates to the valid values for grid control.
ACol and ARow contain the column and row numbers for a cell in the grid control. CheckLimits ensures that the values represent a valid, non-fixed cell in the grid control.

ACol must contain a value in the range 0..ColCount-1, and cannot be a fixed column in the grid. The value in FixedCols is assigned to ACol if it is less than the value in FixedCols. ColCount-1 is assigned to ACol when it is larger than the upper limit.

ARow must contain a value in the range 0..RowCount-1, and cannot be a fixed row in the grid. The value in FixedRows is assigned to ARow if it is less than the value in FixedRows. RowCount-1 is assigned to ARow when it is larger than the upper limit.
CheckLimitsWithError is used when an exception is required for invalid cell coordinates.
CheckLimits is used in the implementation of methods like MoveNextSelectable and TryMoveSelection.

element.name: TCustomGrid.CheckLimits.aCol
element.short: Column number examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.CheckLimits.aRow
element.short: Row number examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.CheckLimitsWithError
element.short: Checks column and row limits for the specified cell, with error trapping.

descr.p: CheckLimitsWithError is a procedure used to ensure that the specified cell coordinates are valid values for grid control.

ACol and ARow contain the column and row numbers for a cell in the grid control. CheckLimitsWithError ensures that the values represent a valid, non-fixed cell in the grid control. ACol must contain a value in the range 0..ColCount-1, and cannot be a fixed column in the grid. ARow must contain a value in the range 0..RowCount-1, and cannot be a fixed row in the grid.
CheckLimitsWithError calls IsColumnIndexValid and IsRowIndexValid to determine whether the corresponding values are valid. If either method returns False, an EGridException is raised.
CheckLimits is used when cell coordinates must be constrained to the values that are valid for the control.
CheckLimitsWithError is used in the implementation of methods like SetCol, SetRow, and SetQuickColRow when AllowOutboundEvents is not enabled.

element.errors: Raises an EGridException exception with the message in rsGridIndexOutOfRange when a column or row number is out of range for the control.

element.name: TCustomGrid.CheckLimitsWithError.aCol

element.name: TCustomGrid.CheckLimitsWithError.aRow

descr.p: Calls VisualChange to update column sizes and redraw the control, and calls the inherited method to notify child controls of the new BidiMode value.

element.name: TCustomGrid.CMMouseEnter
element.short: Handles the control message posted when the mouse enters a cell in the grid.

element.name: TCustomGrid.CMMouseLeave

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColRowDeleted.Index

descr.p: ColRowExchanged has an empty implementation in TCustomGrid. It is implemented in descendent classes like TCustomDrawGrid to update the content in the grid and signal the OnColRowExchanged event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColRowMoved

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColRowToOffset.EndPos

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColumnIndexFromGridColumn
element.short: Gets the position of the specified column relative to the first column in the grid.

descr.p: ColumnIndexFromGridColumn is an Integer function used to get the position of the specified column relative to the first column in the grid. The return value contains the difference between Column and FirstGridColumn when Columns have been enabled in the grid control. RealIndex is called to translate the position used in the return value. If Columns have not been enabled, the return value is -1.
ColumnIndexFromGridColumn is used in the implementation of TCustomGrid methods like:

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColumnIndexFromGridColumn.Result

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColumnFromGridColumn

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColumnsChanged
element.short: Performs actions needed when one or more columns in the grid are changed.

descr.p: ColumnsChanged is procedure used to perform actions needed when one or more Columns in the grid are changed. AColumn contains the column affected by the change, or signals a change to multiple columns when its value is unassigned (contains Nil).

When AColumn is Nil, the row or column count and/or fixed row or fixed column count has been changed. When AColumn contains a valid TGridColumn instance, the modified column is located in the Columns collection and the VisualChange method is called.
ColumnsChanged is called from methods like: SetFixedCols, SetRowCount, and OnTitleFontChanged. It is also called when the Update method in Columns is called for the TGridColumns collection.

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColumnsChanged.aColumn
element.short: Grid column instance for the notification, or Nil.

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColWidthsChanged
element.short: Performs actions needed when the widths for grid columns have been changed.

descr.p: ColWidthsChanged has an empty implementation in TCustomGrid.

element.name: TCustomGrid.CreateColumns
element.short: Allocates and configures resources for the Columns collection.

descr.p: CreateColumns is a TGridColumns function used create a new TGridColumns instance for the grid control. TGridColumn is the class type used for items stored in the collection.
CreateColumns is called from the Create constructor, and the return value is assigned to the member used for the Columns property.

element.name: TCustomGrid.CreateColumns.Result
element.short: TGridColumns instance created in the method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.CheckNewCachedSizes
element.short: Checks the values for cached column sizes when have been reset in the grid.

descr.p: CheckNewCachedSizes has an empty implementation in TCustomGrid.

element.name: TCustomGrid.CreateWnd
element.short: Creates and configures the widgetset handle for the grid control.

descr.p: CreateWnd is an overridden method in TCustomGrid. It calls the inherited method to allocate the Handle for the widgetset class.

CreateWnd ensures that internal flags used for horizontal and vertical scrollbar visibility are updated to reflect the states for the control Handle. The CheckPosition method is called to determine the cell selection in the grid. VisualChange is called to refresh the visible area and scrollbars in the control.

element.name: TCustomGrid.CreateParams.Params
element.short: Creation parameters updated in the method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.Click
element.short: Performs actions when a mouse click occurs in the grid control.

descr.p: Click is an overridden method used to perform action needed when a mouse click occurs in the control. The grid control provides an internal flag to suppress mouse click handling when the event occurs in a "hot zone" (fixed header cells for columns or rows). Click checks the value in the internal flag, and calls the inherited method when the click occurs in the "normal" data cells for the grid.
Click is called from methods like SetCol, SetRow, and SetColRow to emulate a mouse click when values are assigned to the Col and/or Row properties.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DblClick
element.short: Performs actions needed to handle mouse double click events in the control.

descr.p: DblClick is an overridden method used to perform actions needed when a mouse Double Click event occurs in the grid control.
SelectActive is set to False to ignore an active cell or range selection in the control. The internal TGridState member for the control is set to gsNormal to reflect the new state for the control.
DblClick uses values in the Options property to determine whether double click is enabled for column or row sizing operations in the control. Some of the Options values relevant to DblClick include:

dl.dd: Column sizing in enabled for the control.
Row sizing is enabled for the control.
A mouse double click resizes the column automatically.

descr.p: When the needed Options values are present, and match the current CursorState for the control, the corresponding action is performed. AutoAdjustColumn is called for a column resize action. RestoreCursor is called, and HeaderSized is called to signal completion of the column resize operation. Row resize actions for double click mouse events are not currently implemented.
If the values in Options or CursorState do not meet the required conditions, the inherited method is called.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DefaultColWidthIsStored
element.short: Indicates if the DefaultColWidth property is available in component streaming.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DefaultRowHeightIsStored
element.short: Indicates if the DefaultRowHeight property is available in component streaming.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DefineProperties
element.short: Defines non-published properties included during LCL component streaming.

descr.p: DefineProperties is an overridden method used to define non-published properties which are included during LCL component streaming. It sets the read and write routines in Filer used for the following grid properties:

element.name: TCustomGrid.DefineProperties.Filer
element.short: TFiler instance used to read and write the defined properties.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DialogChar
element.short: Applies an accelerator key for a column in the grid.

descr.p: DialogChar is an overridden Boolean function used to apply Lazarus messages with accelerator keys for columns in the grid. Message contains the TLMKey instance with the message examined in the method. DialogChar examines each of the Columns defined for the grid to determine if the CharCode for the Message is an accelerator key appearing in the title for the column. When a match is found, the HeaderClick method is called to activate the column.
The return value contains the result from the inherited DialogChar method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DialogChar.Message
element.short: Lazarus messaged examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoCompareCells
element.short: Performs a comparison between the specified cells in the grid control.

descr.p: DoCompareCells signals the OnCompareCells event handler (when assigned) to perform the comparison. The return value contains the relative sort order for the compared cells, and uses the following values:

dl.dd: The cell at ACol and ARow occurs comes before the cell at BCol and BRow.
The specified cells have the same value.
The cell at ACol and ARow occurs comes after the cell at BCol and BRow.

descr.p: When OnCompareCells is not assigned, the return value is always 0.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoCompareCells.Result
element.short: Relative sort order for the compared cells.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoCompareCells.Acol
element.short: Column number for the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoCompareCells.ARow
element.short: Row number for the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoCompareCells.Bcol
element.short: Column number for the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoCompareCells.BRow
element.short: Row number for the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoCopyToClipboard
element.short: Copies the selected data to the clipboard.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoCutToClipboard
element.short: Cuts the data from its current site and places it in the clipboard.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoEditButtonClick
element.short: Performs actions needed when the button for editor control is clicked.

descr.p: DoEditButtonClick is a procedure used to perform actions requires when the button for a cell editor or button column is clicked.
ACol and ARow contain the Integer coordinates for the cell where the action occurred.
DoEditButtonClick signals the OnEditButtonClick and OnButtonClick event handlers when they have been assigned for the grid control.
DoEditButtonClick is used in the implementation of the EditButtonClicked method used in cell editor controls, and the MouseUp method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoEditButtonClick.ACol
element.short: Column number for the affected cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoEditButtonClick.ARow
element.short: Row number for the affected cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoEditorHide
element.short: Performs actions needed to hide the cell Editor in the grid control.

descr.p: DoEditorHide is a procedure used to hide the cell Editor for the control.

When gfEditingDone is included in the GridFlags for the control, and CanFocus indicates that the control can be focused, it is used as the ActiveControl in the parent Form. The Visible property in Editor is set to False to hide the cell editor for the control.
DoEditorHide is called from the EditorHide method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoEditorShow
element.short: Performs actions needed to show the cell Editor for the grid control.

descr.p: Calls ScrollToCell to position the grid on the cell indicated by the Col and Row properties.

String- and Button-style editor controls are updated to use the alignment defined for the current column. If Columns has not been enabled, the default alignment for the cell is taLeftJustify. Calls EditSetValue to copy the cell content into the cell Editor.
The Editor.SetFocus method is called when the grid control currently has focus and the cell editor can receive focus. InvalidateCell is called to redraw the cell at the position in Col and Row.
DoEditorShow is called from the EditorShow method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoLoadColumn
element.short: Signals the OnLoadColumn event handler for the grid control.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoLoadColumn.Sender
element.short: Object for the event notification.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoLoadColumn.aColumn
element.short: Grid column definition for the event.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoLoadColumn.aColIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the column.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoLoadColumn.aCfg

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoLoadColumn.aVersion
element.short: Version number for the streaming format used in the configuration file.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoLoadColumn.aPath
element.short: XPath-like expression for the column information.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoSaveColumn
element.short: Signals the OnSaveColumn event handler for the grid control.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoMouseWheel
element.short: Applies mouse wheel options and handles a mouse wheel operation.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoAutoAdjustLayout
element.short: Performs actions to apply the auto-layout policy with the specified scaling.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoOPDeleteColRow
element.short: Performs a delete operation for a column or a row.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoOPExchangeColRow
element.short: Performs an exchange for the columns or rows with the specified indexes.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoOPInsertColRow
element.short: Performs an inserting for a column or a row at the specified position.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoOPMoveColRow
element.short: Performs a move operation for the column or row at the specified position.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoPasteFromClipboard
element.short: Pastes data from the clipboard into the current cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoPrepareCanvas
element.short: Performs actions needed to prepare the canvas for a drawing operation.

descr.p: Signals the OnPrepareCanvas event handler (when assigned) to prepare the Canvas for the cell using the specified state. Called from the PrepareCavas method. Allows the default actions performed in the caller to be overridden.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoOnResize
element.short: Performs actions needed when the grid control is resized.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoUTF8KeyPress
element.short: Applies a UTF-8-encoded character to the active cell editor in the control.

descr.p: DoUTF8KeyPress is an overridden method used to apply the UTF-8-encoded character in UTF8Key to the active cell Editor for the control. The return value is True if the character is successfully handled.

DoUTF8KeyPress calls the inherited method on entry to determine if the character is handled in the ancestor class. No additional actions are performed in the method when the character is handled in the ancestor.

Otherwise, EditingAllowed is called to determine if a cell editor can be displayed for the column number in Col. When allowed, the EditorShowChar method is called to apply the value in UTF8Key to the cell Editor. The value in UTF8Key is set to an empty string (''), and the return is set to True on successful completion of the operation.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoUTF8KeyPress.Result
element.short: True if the character was successfully applied in the method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoUTF8KeyPress.UTF8Key
element.short: UTF-8 character value handled in the method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawBorder
element.short: Draws the border for the grid control.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawAllRows
element.short: Draws all of the rows for the grid.

descr.p: Draws both the fixed rows and any visible data rows using cached information in the grid control. Calls DrawRow to render each row by its row number in the control.
DrawAllRows is called from the Paint method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawFillRect
element.short: Draws the fill rectangle on the specified canvas.

descr.p: Shifts the specified rectangle by one pixel on the left- and right-hand edges when UseRightToLeftAlignment is set to True. Calls the FillRect method in the TCanvas instance to draw the adjusted rectangle.
DrawFillRect is called from the DrawCell method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawFillRect.aCanvas
element.short: Canvas where the fill rectangle is drawn.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawFillRect.R
element.short: Rectangle with the bounds filled in the method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawCell
element.short: Draws a cell using a given state at the specified grid location (Col, Row, rectangle).

descr.p: Calls PrepareCanvas to initialize the Canvas for the control to the state in AState. Calls DrawFillRect to fill the rectangle in ARect using the background for the cell. Calls DrawCellGrid to render fixed or non-fixed cells using the state in AState, including horizontal and vertical grid lines when enabled.
DrawCell is called from the DrawRow method when it renders the visible cells in the grid row.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawCell.aCol
element.short: Column number for the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawCell.aRow
element.short: Row number for the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawCell.aRect
element.short: Rectangle with the dimensions for the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawCell.aState
element.short: State used to render the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawCellGrid
element.short: Draws cell grid lines for the control.

descr.p: DrawCellGrid is a procedure used to draw cell grid lines for both a fixed and a non-fixed cell in the grid control.
DrawCellGrid ensures that the control Canvas (and its Pen) are updated to use the values needed to draw the fixed or non-fixed cell at the location specified in ACol and ARow.

For a fixed cell (when gdFixed is in AState), grid lines are drawn when gdoFixedVertLine or gdoFixedHorzLine is found in the Options property. The Pen in the control Canvas is updated to reflect a non-zero value in GridLineWidth.

When Flat is set to False, the value in AState is used to determine the color used for the Pen. Canvas drawing methods, like MoveTo and LineTo, are used to draw the cell grid lines at the coordinates in ARect. The value in UseRightToLeftAlignment determines how values in ARect are adjusted for the operation.
When Flat is set to True, the value in FixedGridLineColor is used as the color for the Pen.

For a non-fixed cell (gdFixed is not in AState), grid lines are drawn when gdoVertLine or gdoHorzLine is found in the Options property. The Pen in the control Canvas is updated to use the GridLineWidth, GridLineStyle, and GridLineColor for the control. Canvas drawing methods, like MoveTo and LineTo, are used to draw the cell grid lines at the coordinates in ARect. The value in UseRightToLeftAlignment determines how values in ARect are adjusted for the operation.
DrawCellGrid is called from the DrawCell method after preparing the Canvas and drawing the filled rectangle with the background for the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawCellGrid.ACol
element.short: Column number for the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawCellGrid.ARow
element.short: Row number for the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawCellGrid.ARect
element.short: Rectangle with the screen coordinates for the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawCellGrid.AState
element.short: State for the cell (normal, fixed, pushed, et. al.).

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawTextInCell
element.short: Draws the text for a non-fixed cell in the grid.

descr.p: The implementation for DrawTextInCell is empty in TCustomGrid. It is overridden in descendent classes.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawThemedCell
element.short: Draws a cell using the theme services for the specified grid drawing state.

descr.p: DrawThemedCell is a procedure used to draw the cell at the specified coordinates using the theme services for the platform or widget set.
aCol contains the column number for the affected cell.
aRow contains the row number for the affected cell.
aRect contains the screen coordinates for the cell rendered in the method.

aState contains the grid drawing state applied to the cell. aState contains a value from the TGridDrawState enumeration that determines the theme service element details used for the drawing operation.

tr.td: Draws the cell using the Pressed state
Draws the cell using the Hotlighted state
Draws the cell using the normal drawing state

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawThemedCell.aCol
element.short: Column number for the affected cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawThemedCell.aRow
element.short: Row number for the affected cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawThemedCell.aRect
element.short: Screen coordinates for the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawThemedCell.aState
element.short: Grid drawing state for the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawCellText
element.short: Draws the specified text in the given text rectangle.

descr.p: DrawCellText is a procedure used to draw the text specified in AText using the given text rectangle on the Canvas for the control. The Canvas also contains the alignment and layout used for the text drawn in the method.

ARect contains the Canvas coordinates for the text is drawn. DrawCellText adjusts the bounds in ARect to account for the cell padding used in the control (varCellPadding) as needed for the text aligment and layout. The TextRect method in the Canvas is called to render the text.
Values in the ACol, ARow, and AState parameters are not used in DrawCellText.
DrawCellText is used in the implementation of the DrawColumnText, DrawCellAutonumbering, and DrawTextInCell methods where AText contains the column title, row number, or content for a given cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawCellText.aCol
element.short: Not used in the current implementation.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawCellText.aRow
element.short: Not used in the current implementation.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawCellText.aRect
element.short: Text rectangle for the text drawn on the control canvas.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawCellText.aState
element.short: Not used in the current implementation.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawCellText.aText
element.short: Text drawn in the method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawGridCheckboxBitmaps
element.short: Draws a checkbox bitmap which represents the given state in a cell.

descr.p: DrawGridCheckboxBitmaps is used to draw a bitmap used for a checkbox at the cell coordinates in ACol and aRow. AState contains the checkbox state for the cell, and determines the image displayed in the specified cell.

GetImageForCheckBox is called to get the image list, image index, and/or bitmap used in the cell. Use the OnUserCheckBoxImage or OnUserCheckboxBitmap event handler to get a custom image or bitmap displayed for the value in AState. If GetImageForCheckBox is unable to find either a bitmap or an image, ThemeServices is used to get the theme element details for the checkbox state.
The bitmap/image/theme element may be scaled if the control Font uses a display density (PPI) different than the value used for the Screen.

When Columns has been Enabled, the GetColumnAlignment and GetColumnLayout methods are used to determine the image alignment and layout used for the checkbox cell. If Columns has not been enabled, the image is centered horizontally in the cell using the vertical alignment defined for text on the Canvas.
DrawGridCheckboxBitmaps adjusts ARect to use the cell padding for the control (varCellPadding) along with the size, alignment and layout needed for the grid column.
The checkbox bitmap is drawn using the mechanism needed for the image source; ThemeService.DrawElement, Canvas.StretchDraw, or TScaledImageListResolution.StretchDraw.
DrawGridCheckboxBitmaps is called from the DrawCellCheckboxBitmaps method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawGridCheckboxBitmaps.aCol
element.short: Column number for the checkbox cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawGridCheckboxBitmaps.aRow
element.short: Row number for the checkbox cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawGridCheckboxBitmaps.aRect
element.short: Rectangle with the bounds for the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawGridCheckboxBitmaps.aState
element.short: Checkbox state used to determine the bitmap drawn in the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawButtonCell
element.short: Draws a cell in a button-style column.

descr.p: DrawButtonCell is a method used to draw a cell which appears in a button-style column. DrawButtonCell uses ThemeServices to get the theme element details used to render the button for the cell.

AState contains the drawing state for the button, and determines the theme element details used for the drawing state. The ThemeServices.DrawElement method is called to render the button on the control Canvas at the location specified in ARect.
DrawButtonCell is called from DefaultDrawCell when the column has a button-style definition.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawButtonCell.aCol
element.short: Column number for the button cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawButtonCell.aRow
element.short: Row number for the button cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawButtonCell.aRect
element.short: Rectangle with the bounds where the button is drawn.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawButtonCell.aState
element.short: Drawing state for the button cell; pushed, hot, or normal.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawColRowMoving
element.short: Draws a column or row when dragging is in effect.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawColumnText
element.short: Draws the text and image for a grid column title at the specified cell coordinates.

descr.p: DrawColumnText is a method used to draw the text and image for a grid column title at the cell coordinates specified in ACol and ARow. DrawColumnText calls DrawColumnTitleImage to draw the sort indicator for the column. DrawCellText is called to render the text for the cell using the specified drawing state.
DrawColumnText is called from the DefaultDrawCell method in descendent classes for cells which are fixed column titles.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawColumnText.aCol
element.short: Column number for the column title.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawColumnText.aRow
element.short: Row number for the column title.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawColumnText.aRect
element.short: Rectangle with the bounds for the column title.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawColumnText.aState
element.short: Drawing state for the text in the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawColumnTitleImage
element.short: Draws the image(s) used in the column title at the specified index in the grid.

descr.p: DrawColumnTitleImage is a method used to draw the image(s) used in the column title at the index position in AColumnIndex. ARect contains the bounds for the cell where the image is drawn.

When AColumnIndex contains the same value as the SortColumn property, a sort indicator is drawn for the column. GetSortTitleImageInfo is called to determine whether theme services is used to drawn native sort buttons using theme element details. The image size may be scaled when the display density (PPI) for the control Font has a value other than 96.

DrawColumnTitleImage ensures that image padding (DEFIMAGEPADDING) is applied to the bounds in ARect. The top and bottom bounds are adjusted so that the image is vertically centered in the area in ARect.
DrawColumnTitleImage calls the DrawElement method in ThemeServices to draw the sort indicator.

When native sort indicators are not used for the column, an image scaled to the display density is retrieved from the image list. DrawColumnTitleImage ensures that image padding (DEFIMAGEPADDING) is applied to the bounds in ARect. The top and bottom bounds are adjusted so that the image is vertically centered in the area in ARect. The Draw method in the scaled image resolution is called to draw the image on the control Canvas.

TitleImageList is used to determine if an additional image is displayed for the column at AColumnIndex. When TitleImageList has been assigned, the GetTitleImageInfo method is called to get the image list and position used for the column. When an image is defined in Columns, an image scaled to the size size needed for the display densitity (PPI) is retrieved from TitleImageList. The bounds in ARect is adjusted to include padding around the image (DEFIMAGEPADDING) usiing the image layout for the column. The Draw method in the scaled image resolution is called to render the image to the control Canvas.
DrawColumnTitleImage is called from the DrawColumnText method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawColumnTitleImage.ARect
element.short: Rectangle with the bounds for the column title.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawColumnTitleImage.AColumnIndex
element.short: Column Index for the title image drawn in the method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawEdges
element.short: Draws the edges (and filled background) of the client area for the control.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawFocusRect
element.short: Draws the focus rectangle for the specified cell.

descr.p: DrawFocusRect has an empty implementation in TCustomGrid. It is overridden in descendent classes.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawFocusRect.aCol
element.short: Column number for the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawFocusRect.aRow
element.short: Row number for the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawFocusRect.ARect
element.short: TRect instance with the bounds for the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawRow
element.short: Draws the columns for the specified row in the grid control.

descr.p: DrawRow is a method used to draw the columns for the row number specified in ARow. DrawRow calls ColRowToOffSet to get the upper and lower bounds for the row, and ensures that the bounds are within the clipping area for the control Canvas.
No actions are performed in the method when the client area for the row does not fit within the clipping rectangle for the control Canvas.

DrawRow iterates over the columns in the visible area in the grid to determine if each cell fits vertically within the clipping rectangle for the control Canvas. If column spanning (goColSpanning) has been enabled in the Options for the grid, the cell extent is determined for each cell. DoDrawCell is called to render the cells.
DrawRow draws the focus rectangle for the row when row selection (goRowSelect) is enabled in the Options for the grid control. DrawFocusRect is called to render the focus rectangle.
DrawRow draws fixed cells used for title columns when the row is one of the fixed rows.
DrawRow is called from the DrawAllRows method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawRow.aRow
element.short: Row number drawn in the method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditButtonClicked
element.short: Signals the OnEditButtonClick or OnButtonClick event handler (when assigned).

descr.p: When Sender is the TButtonCellEditor for the control, the DoEditButtonClick method is called using the Col and Row numbers from the TButtonCellEditor class instance. Otherwise, DoEditButtonClick is called using the values in the Col and Row properties.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditButtonClicked.Sender
element.short: Object for the event notification.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorDoGetValue
element.short: Gets the value for the cell Editor.

descr.p: EditorDoGetValue creates a GM_GETVALUE TGridMessage with the Col, Row, and value for the cell. It is dispatched to the Editor for the control. SetEditText is called prior to exiting from the method; not used in TCustomGrid - but relevant in descendent classes with an event handler for the action.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorDoResetValue
element.short: Resets the value in the selected cell when a visible editor is cancelled or hidden.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorDoSetValue
element.short: Sets the mask and value for a visible cell editor in the grid control.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorCanAcceptKey
element.short: Returns True if the Editor is able to accept the specified UTF-8 key.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorIsReadOnly
element.short: Determines if the current column number is defined as read-only.

descr.p: Calls GetColumnReadonly using the value in Col as the column number.

When the Columns collection has been enabled, the ReadOnly property in the TGridColumn instance determines the return value. Otherwise, the value from GetDefaultColumnReadOnly is used as the return value (False in TCustomGrid).

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorHide
element.short: Hides a visible cell editor in the grid control.

descr.p: EditorHide ensures that an active, visible cell editor is locked / hidden / unlocked in the method. No actions are performed in the method when EditorLocked returns True, or the Editor is not visible.
EditorHide sets the value in EditorMode to False, and sets GridState to gsNormal.

No additional actions are performed when the Editor does not have a Parent (when the parent form is closing). If the Editor has an assigned Parent, the Editor is locked and DoEditorHide is called to hide the Editor. If the Editor was focused on entry, SetFocus is called to restore focus to the grid control. The editor is unlocked prior to exiting from the method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorLocked
element.short: Returns True if the Editor is locked, i.e. unable to accept input or make changes.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorLocked.Result
element.short: True when LockEditor has been called and UnLockEditor has not yet been called.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditingAllowed
element.short: Indicates if the grid and specified column allow editing.

descr.p: Returns True if both the grid and the specified column allow editing. The return value is True when all of the following conditions are satisfied:

ul.li: goEditing is included in the Options property
ACol contains a valid column index
RowCount has a value larger than the value in FixedRows
The Columns collection has been Enabled (contains at least one visible column)
A TGridColumn instance exists for the column index in ACol
The TGridColumn instance is not marked as read-only

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditingAllowed.Result
element.short: Returns True if both the grid and the current column allow editing.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditingAllowed.ACol
element.short: Column number examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorSelectAll
element.short: Performs actions to select the entire content in the current cell.

descr.p: EditorSelectAll is a method used to select the entire content in the current cell when the Editor is active and visible. EditorSelectAll creates, configures, and dispatches a TGridMessage using the GM_SELECTALL message constant to the Editor in the grid control.
No actions are performed in the method when Editor has not been assigned (contains Nil).
EditorSelectAll is called from the EditorShow method when its SelAll argument is set to True, and from the IMEStartComposition method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorShow
element.short: Displays the Editor for the selected cell.

descr.p: Displays and enables the cell Editor for the selected cell, and optionally selects all content in the cell.

No actions are performed in the method at design-time, or during LCL component streaming. The grid control must have an allocated Handle, and be Enabled and Visible (including the Parent). In addition, both the grid and the column must allow editing. Use Options to enable editing in grid cells. Use Columns to define TGridColumn instances with editable columns using the required button style for the column data.
No actions are performed in the method when Editor has not been assigned, or has already been displayed, or is currently locked by a call to LockEditor.

EditorShow sets the value in EditorMode to True, and saves the existing cell value on entry. EditorShowing is set to True to indicate that the Editor is visible, and calls doEditorShow to display the Editor control.

SelAll indicates whether all of the content in the cuirrent cell is selected in the Editor for the control. When set to True, the EditorSelectAll method is called to post the GM_SELECTALL message to the Editor control. The value in GridState is set to gsNormal prior to exiting from the method.
EditorShow is called when the value goAlwaysShowEditor is included in the Options for the grid control. It is also called from methods like:

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorShow.SetAll
element.short: True to select the entire content for the cell in the Editor.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorShowInCell
element.short: Shows the cell content for the Editorin situ.

notes.note: Not used in the current implementation.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorShowInCell.aRow

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorWidthChanged
element.short: Performs actions needed when the width for a cell Editor has been changed.

descr.p: EditorWidthChanged performs actions needed to update the width for the cell Editor when a column width in the grid has been changed. EditorWidthChanged calls the EditorPos method to set the position, bounds, and font for the Editor.
EditorWidthChanged is called when a new value is assigned to the indexed ColWidths property, and when column widths are adjusted when AutoFillColumns is set to True.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorWidthChanged.aCol

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorWidthChanged.aWidth
